website_summaries.verdict: Quick to dry and easy to transport. Immediately adaptable to life in most environments.
pros: The ability to dry a pair of jeans in minutes is one feature we love
High marks for design and function
Works great anywhere from NYC apartments to RVs
cons: Draining water isn't difficult, but buying an extra piece may help

customer_reviews.title: Nina soft spin dryer
customer_reviews.text: Omg I just received it this am and I love it. Works amazing leaves my clothes pretty dry and ready to hang them to dry completely. Only thing i wish it had was a ON and OFF button and a small matching pink bowl to drain the water in. I got a pink small waste basket at the dollar tree store and cut a piece from the side so it can fit under the drain to drain the water in.Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kay77

customer_reviews.title: ZERO CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: The product came missing a part (the rubber disc that goes inside the spinner). I tried contacting the manufacturer for 2 weeks, and NEVER heard back from them. ZERO customer service = angry customer!! I would not recommend this product to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hadley

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: We use this product on a daily basis along with another Laundry Alternative product the Wonderwash. Both products works great and seamlessly together. We did have an issue with our first Nina Spin Dryer mysteriously stopped working, but Amazon was quick to replace the item seamlessly and we have not had an issue since! We use this daily as a family of four for our only dryer. This item is roughly the size of a kitchen trashcan (the barrel foot-petal type) and we use a stock pot to catch the water for 3 towels. One full load is roughly 3 towels, 2 men's pants, and 4 shirts.
customer_reviews.author: Kamiren Jane

customer_reviews.title: Good product, problems with company honoring warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Spin dries clothes well. Item arrived without one bottom foot. I contacted the manufacturer and had many problems with them. I provided the order number and they stated they could not find the order on Amazon so they could not help me. I sent them copies of the invoice via email and they would not accept it as proof of purchase. It became so frustrating that I would have returned the product for refund, except it works very well. I have no faith in the company interms of helping with replacing the missing part or any future problems that may occur.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Damaged badly on arrival, twice.
customer_reviews.text: The product is in a thin cardboard box with very little styrofoam inside to protect the spinner. The first one was severely dented so I sent to back. The replacement was even more damaged. I wish I could use the product. All I could do was to send it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: LINY

customer_reviews.title: just get a husband
customer_reviews.text: piece of crap doesn't work. customer service lies and doesn't help. they only send out returned products. waste of money. no visible warning on the plug not to plug in because it means it's turning it on. they have all these abnormal bells and whistles at the bottom in order to be able to "plug in" ie "AUTO turn on" without direct knowledge of this. this thing is more than complicated, not worth the recurring credit card bill, built crappily and as the faux, laughing representative said, 97% of them are returned for this reason and they still make it like this. just use your apartment's washer and dryer or get your husband.
customer_reviews.author: Cause I'm a LADY 🕷️🕸️

customer_reviews.title: Nice product except Handle Detaches When Moving
customer_reviews.text: I have one concern with this item: When moving it, the handle may unexpectedly pull off. This is a heavy item to be moving and to have it unexpectedly detach. You cannot roll this item around, it must be carried. And yes, I am careful to make sure that the handle is correctly attached/placed and "locked" in. Although I am happy with the spinner otherwise, I am concerned about this issue. The company has been in contact with me.
customer_reviews.author: Kate H.

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended, small capacity
customer_reviews.text: This is really good for batch towels, even with front loaders that generally spin out the water good to start. It could be a little safer on the design in terms of stopping (open top while spinning down). However the 12lb sized unit is very small, can only fit 2 full size bath towels. The total spin time needed is more around 10 minutes instead of 3 if you really want to get the water spun out. Get the biggest size possible or the time you save in drying will be taken up by having to spin multiple items. Build quality is decent, especially for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Greenwalt

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all!
customer_reviews.text: I removed the bar and plastic clips the item does not work at all! would not come on. read all the reviews and I know I did it right. Total failure out of the box! I wanted this item for 2 years now I have to return it. In fairness I order one more to try again if it doesn't work I will get a refund. Very disappointed! UPDATE: ITEM WAS REPLACED WITH A WORKING SPIN DRYER! I LOVE IT! WORKS SO GOOD..
customer_reviews.author: Maria Huet

customer_reviews.title: For hand washing, quiet and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't need this for laundry. I spin and knit with wool, and wash fleece from sheep to spin with. After hand washing knit items, yarn, and fleece, using the washing machine to spin them can be bad--even fatal--for the machine because of loose fibers. The Nina works perfectly, and my wool gets drier in 2 minutes in the Nina than it did in 11 minutes in my washing machine's spin cycle. The Nina was larger than I envisioned, and larger than I really need, but it is very light weight, so I store it in a closet and just bring it out when needed. And it is whisper quiet.
customer_reviews.author: catherine

customer_reviews.title: i absolutely love this Nina spin dryer
customer_reviews.text: i absolutely love this Nina spin dryer. first let me say i bought the Panda 5.5 lb counter top washing machine with spin basket which works great for my needs. this new laundry alternative Nina soft spin dryer works so much better and gets much more water out of the clothes. i use the panda just for washing now, and just throw the clothes in the Nina spin dryer. So much faster to get the job done. Wash and Spin a load at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: smooth running
customer_reviews.text: love this extractor! doesn't hold a lot at one time---like one sheet and pillow case---but in 20-30 seconds it has spun almost all the water out. it is perfect for wool that you cannot run through the washing machine (or it will shrink.) hand wash and spin in this machine. (spinning does not shrink wool-- agitation does. i hand spin yarn and this is the perfect way to clean yarn or raw sheep fleece to get it clean without felting it. it is surprisingly quiet running. for hand laundry at the cabin--- it takes 80%of the work out of washing clothes and they are way cleaner than using a wringer.
customer_reviews.author: spinnerknitter

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item one year ago. I've only used it about four times in the entire year. I used it to dry socks, two microfiber light towels, and swimsuits. So basically, very small and light items. Today, I've just tried to plug it in and IT DOESN'T WORK. What a waste of money. Save your money and go to the laundry mat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME product !
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! Spins clothes dryer than the washing machine I used to have. Quiet, light-weight, very portable! I also take it camping to spin-dry the swimming clothes and in case I need to hand wash and dry. The handle makes it easy to carry (very light). It also spins clothes quickly (1-2 minutes), and the clothes come out almost dry. VERY PLEASED WITH THIS PRODUCT! Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Hester Prynne

customer_reviews.title: Spins almost completely dry.
customer_reviews.text: We have an RV and it works so well for hand washing and I have even done jeans. It spins everything almost completely dry. I just got it so as far as durability I am just hoping it is because I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patty McKeon

customer_reviews.title: It is QUIET and effectively removes H20!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: As above! I love this unit, it is worth the investment. The thought of washing my clothes in this "hi-rise" with a multitude of people using the same w/d made me nauseated. With the "Breathing Mobile Washer Classic" I am able to wash my clothes, spin them and place on drying rack (this place is way OVER heated, so I can take adavantage of that fact) to dry. It's wonderful. No kidding--I am a highly clean person and very critical and this is a very good purchase. Blessings, Leah.....(a physical On/Off button would be nice, but no real issue there, considering the overall performance.) ""
customer_reviews.author: Benisons

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to spin my washed sheep fleeces, newly spun yarn, and hand knit items. It works perfectly for my needs and really gets the excess water out of my items so air-drying takes less time. I took two skeins of yarn I had just washed and hand-squeezed all the water I could out of them. I then put them in the ninja and it spun an additional half cup of water out of them! It has been well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: A. Blokland

customer_reviews.title: Best Money I Ever Spent
customer_reviews.text: I am SO happy that I bought this. I wash most of my clothes by hand because it's more convenient than going to a laundromat. I really didn't like wringing the stuff out by hand because I could never wring enough water out, but this spin dryer really does the trick. I just spin the washed and rinsed clothes out, put them on hangers and hang them on my shower curtain rod and in a few hours the things are dry. A wonderful, ingenious, convenient and money saving product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: L. Romans

customer_reviews.title: Way easier than ringing and even better than a regular washing machine spin cycle
customer_reviews.text: Truly gets so much water out. Way easier than ringing and even better than a regular washing machine spin cycle. It is a bit annoying that it's so finicky about getting off balance. You have to load it just right or it will wobble like crazy. But still way better than any other options I have at the moment so not too bad to put up with.
customer_reviews.author: e. blue

customer_reviews.title: DOA!
customer_reviews.text: It was dead on arrival. Had to send it back, not taking a chance with a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This actually works really well once you get used to how it operates. If you have used a regular washing machine, you know how to load clothes evenly. Just make sure the heaviest stuff is on the bottom and you distribute the weight evenly as you go. Certainly preferable to wringing out clothes by hand. Customer service is great. Before ordering I saw some bad reviews on the customer service and I was a bit worried. My dryer arrived with a large crack in the outer plastic. I contacted customer service and they immediately sent me a replacement, no problems except the delay in my order.
customer_reviews.author: seeway

customer_reviews.title: It's Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: It really does a fantastic job or spinning *almost* all of the water out after washing. Things are still a bit damp after a 2 minute cycle, but just hang them to dry & they're ready to be folded & put away. I really can't say anymore than everyone else here already has, so go get one for yourself if you have limited space for a "dryer" as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Meister

customer_reviews.title: The Nina does such a great job of spinning out water that most things dry ...
customer_reviews.text: We have been hand washing clothes for over a year and hanging them to dry, but during the winter months I didn't want to have to deal with all my laundry hanging to dry in my kitchen at once (those sheets take up a lot of space). The Nina does such a great job of spinning out water that most things dry overnight. I will continue to hand wash indefinitely now, because it is better for my clothes and better for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service! When this little spin dryer arrived, I misunderstood a reviewer's comment/instruction, thought I had to remove or cut a wire to unlock the machine, and luckily I decided to send an email to the seller before 'destroying' my new spin dryer. The seller replied me the same night and walked me through turning it on and answered my questions. Now in 2020, I'm still using this little genie! I can't live without it, and I hope they continue manufacturing them! ;)
customer_reviews.author: E.H.

customer_reviews.title: It never worked
customer_reviews.text: I thought after reading all these reviews i got a great spin dryer, but it is the worst I experienced. The first one came in damaged, so good Amazon lets you return the item no problem. I got the second one shipped to me, and what a surprise it did not work either. Would not spin.
customer_reviews.author: easingpaw

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It does exactly what it is advertised to do. It is a centrifugal water extractor. It removes water. It does not dry your clothes. Undergarments are slightly damp when spun. Knit shirts are damp and take 2-3 hours to dry. Jeans dry over night. I haven't figured out how to do towels. They turn out crunchy and hard. We now throw the towels in the dryer and that solves that problem. They take little time to dry in the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Windycitydew

customer_reviews.title: Love my Nina
customer_reviews.text: Why did I buy it? For me, the worst part of hand washing in ringing out the clothes after. Now, I actually don't mind hand washing my delicates at all because I put them in the Nina and they are much drier than I could ever achieve. I read lots of reviews for this dryer before purchasing. It is really the coolest home appliance I own. It is a bit bigger than I thought. I had expected it to be more noisy but it is very quiet. But it works very well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Tomajan

customer_reviews.title: We use in our RV.
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome once you figure out what you need to do. I was a bit confused at first. Need to make sure you balance the items you put in there. Put the pink plastic on top of the clothes. To really get the items wrung out, spin, flip the clothes around and spin again. I like to get as much water as I can out before hanging to complete the drying. This machine works great. It's light weight. We bring with us for long trips in the RV. I also bought a Costway Mini Washing Machine Small Compact Washer. Both work great together.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Tonjum

customer_reviews.title: Extreme noise
customer_reviews.text: Is this suppose to b sooooo noisy?!!!! Its spins fabric but extremely noisey i thought it was broken!
customer_reviews.author: michelle m mcnamara

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed at the water it extracts from hand wrung clothes
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Nina Soft Spin dryer. The only thing I regret is not purchasing it two years ago. Truly a five star product. I am amazed at the water it extracts from hand wrung clothes. I currently live in a wonderful studio apartment but it does not have a washer and dryer. Since I detest going to the laundromat, I usually hand wash my clothes daily. There is a great side effect of hand washing in that I've discovered my clothes don't wear out. I would use this spin dryer even if I had a washer and dryer. It would cut down on drying time using your standard dryer. Very happy with the product. Highly recommend for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are currently rooming with five other people, and naturally we have a lot of laundry. The house dryer is also older and very slow, which can make the wait times to get laundry done pretty long. With this, I can do smaller loads by hand and spin them out, then hang them up to wait for the dryer (if they don't dry out first).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Its fast
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Its fast, quiet and nice looking. I like being able to do one item at a time, or several, and seeing how much soap is still in the water, and I love being able to wash a top at 10:30 am and wear it at 2:00 pm. Most of my clothes are hand washable so it saves a lot of drying time. It works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Perpetual Student

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!! I love mine.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ!! Great investment for RVs and apt living where you have to use a public laundry room. I read the reviews and took the advice of layering heavy items on the bottom and light on top AND pushing clothing to the outside. I haven't had a single problem with an off balance load yet. 😀 I spin a full load about 5 min and that seems perfect! I hat ironing, but well worth it for the time saved not having to wait for a machine in a public facility.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Lori K

customer_reviews.title: Functionality needs to improve
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for a couple of years. It first came with a foot rubber missing so I returned and got a replacement which was easy to do since I saved all the packing materials. It works fine but I am surprised that it doesn't have a timer or an on/off switch. It should not be difficult to design it so that it stops with a timer. It's a pain to pull the plug (literally) yourself to stop the spinning and to remeber to do that after a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: MKY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This dryer is small and it is easy to store. It is also very quiet and potent, I am so pleased that my clothes are only dump after a spin cycle and air dry really fast. This machine is so easy to operate with only a on/off mechanism. This machine is made in Brazil, and I have never been disappointed with products "made in Brazil", no matter what I buy. Excellent product worth the value.
customer_reviews.author: Ana G.

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but quality is not good.
customer_reviews.text: The first time we received this dryer; it was an open box product. The poly bag was opened and the dust was covered everywhere. Therefore we requested an exchange. We tried the second one. It worked good; however, we found out there was a crack on it. We have no choice to return this again.
customer_reviews.author: SFKK

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for about a month. I wash using the wonder washer and dry with the Nina soft. This product extracts so much water that I can hang my clothes on a rack to air dry without the worry of dripping water. My light weight clothes dry within a couple hours and towels almost 24 hours to completely dry. I can wash my sheets in the morning and put them on my bed that night. I live where it is very humid and it seems to dry just fine. This product is also very quiet when used according to the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it seemed like one was stuck to the electrical wiring inside of ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got this yesterday, I read the instructions and when I tried to clip off the bottom zip ties, it seemed like one was stuck to the electrical wiring inside of the machine. I carefully removed it and when I put in my damp clothes, plugged it in properly with my damp clothes inside topped with the plastic, it didn't do anything. So therefore, I payed $150 for a defective item.. I want a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Eliani

customer_reviews.title: Great for sweaters
customer_reviews.text: I hand wash sweaters in my kitchen sink and spin the out in this machine before hanging them on a rack. With a fan everything dries in a couple of hours. So much better than my old method of rolling wet sweaters in towels! I’ve only used it for wool and cashmere so I don’t know how well it works for jeans or sheets. It does a fantastic job with sweaters.
customer_reviews.author: alaskan

customer_reviews.title: Can't Do Without It. Great for delicate or sturdy items.
customer_reviews.text: Great for spinning hand washables. It does not stretch the fabric. Gets them to a damp dry condition. Most items dry on a rack in less than two hours. I've had my spinner for 11 months. I use it at least twice a week...More than 20 items a week. I have even spun bathroom rugs. No problems whatsoever with my spinner. When this one " dies", I will definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Bayou Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Stellar
customer_reviews.text: This is so very effective. It's one of the most cost effective and important things we've ever bought. It's hard to explain. Have you been to the gym and taken a shower with your shorts on and then gone into the locker room and placed your shorts into that little high-speed spinner and come out with shorts you can wear right under your clothes? It's like that, except you can do it in volume. Sheets, towels, jeans, many objects at once. Then you can air-dry them in open air or on a line in a tenth of the time. This thing probably spins at about 1000 r.p.m. It just dries stuff really well. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry  Lynn Harris

customer_reviews.title: R2D2s cousin does the job!
customer_reviews.text: .Moved in to a new apartment, no washer dryer or even connections. Bought this as a solution for not being jumped and stabbed 3 times at my local laundry place. Super easy to operate. Connect to a power outlet, put your soak clothes in, put the lid thing on top, close the top and Boomshakalaka! clothes come out feeling damp like you just worked out in them and hang to dry them in about 12-24hrs depending on material. Really good product, would totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jedijay

customer_reviews.title: Balancing the drum is very important.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that the clothing comes out almost completely dry. As far as wrinkle free is concerned, that is not necessarily the case for cotton clothing. But for me it is a small price to pay not having to buy a dryer and heat up my clothing every time I do laundry. My aim has been to save money and time and this spin dryer has done just that for me. I'm hoping in the long run that I will be saving my clothing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rtm

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly well. Even the self balancing feature works well. With mindful loading, it's only ever been out of balance to need reloading once. Used for RVing, and made laundry manageable.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Company...not so great product
customer_reviews.text: While nice looking and portable, it does take a very long time to spin dry basically one outfit. As stated in their description, it does not totally dry the items. It basically works the same as a salad spinner but for clothes. The company's customer service is great to deal with--no hassles. I had expected it to spin dry (the same as the salad spinner) all the clothing in my small apartment-size washer at once and hoped that it would have wrung more of the left in water than my washer could drain. But I refuse to spend all day doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Nella Monaco-Wells

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is so great if you are handwashing clothes! We lived at an apartment that didn't have in-unit washers and dryers and the facilities were just too expensive so we decided to hand-wash. The washing part isn't a big deal to me, but the wringing out is just too difficult (especially jeans!). So we go this and I'm so happy with it. It is easy to use, works great and clothes rarely take longer than an hour to dry.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alonzo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for apartment dwellers!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as I was tired of having to pay to use the laundry facilities on site. The dryers here do not dry at all! This spin dryer does a fantastic job of getting the water out of my clothes. It doesn’t get the clothes 100% dry but gets about 90% of the water out. I just hang dry my garments and they are good after a couple hours!
customer_reviews.author: jayne

customer_reviews.title: A+ - Dry laundry, alpaca/sheep fiber in less than a minute.
customer_reviews.text: wife here: This is phenomenal !! I wash our sheep and alpaca fiber (to make yarn) and it usually takes days to dry properly. This takes out almost ALL of the water in less than a minute. Highly recommended. I am going to use it to dry the laundry fast too. Very happy. Great product. Fed Ex brought it in less than 2 days. It is portable and light. Use it inside or out. Bowl will catch the water out of the drain. So handy.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great for Processing Wool Fleece
customer_reviews.text: I do not know how I got along without this spin dryer. I use it as a final spin for scoured wool fleece. My batches are not very heavy but can be very water logged. When I put the load in, I sometimes have to hold the dryer as it starts for the heavier loads. This keeps it from jumping around off kilter. After a brief moment, I can walk away and let it do its job. It saves so much time in drying fleece. It is heaven sent. I have paired this with the large Apollo Horticulture Mesh Drying Rack for a perfect fleece drying experience! :) Trust me for scouring fleece, it is the best investment.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda S.

customer_reviews.title: SHOULD'VE LISTENED TO THE BAD REVIEWS. BOUGHT ANYWAYS AND REGRETTED IT IMMEDIATELY. DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping that I would get a working one. I should've listened to all of the 1-star reviews. I got mine and it would jerk like it wanted to start working but did nothing. Now I have a sink full of wet clothes and a product that didn't work at all. Bummer! I'm returning it and looking for another spin dryer before we head out as full time RVers.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely repurchase this one.
customer_reviews.text: This is an extractor more than a dryer. I have used it to extract more water (2/3 cup) from two pair of jeans that I had washed in a commercial washer. When I hung them to dry indoors they dried much faster than if I had used the commercial washer alone. It’s whisper-quiet. Don’t forget to have something in place to catch the water BEFORE YOU INSERT THE CLOTHES, because water will start dripping out, especially with hand-washed items. When you’re finished it helps to tilt the extractor forward to release the last few drops of water that will be left before storing it. This is a great little machine. I would definitely re-purchase this one.
customer_reviews.author: lingal1

customer_reviews.title: I wash the laundry for the 2 adults, almost ...
customer_reviews.text: I wash the laundry for the 2 adults, almost 16 year old manchild (6'2" & 205 lbs.), 7 year old boy and 5 year old girl with a mobile breathing washer in our tub. This spins out the water so I don't have to wring by hand. The laundry is set out on the rack right before I go to bed at 2 am with a fan on and is dry when I wake up at 9 am.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: twin tub portable -must have
customer_reviews.text: this bad boy ROCKS! Bought a twin tub portable that washed great but the unit has a small but effective spinner but spinning twice per load was a drag so i hopped back on Amazon and ordered this and MAN it will spin a load by itself but for a little buffer i spin 70/30 using both and you talk about dry!
customer_reviews.author: robert      chandler

customer_reviews.title: Saves me time
customer_reviews.text: I only put 2 or 3 things in at a time & let them spin for a couple minutes. This gets them pretty dry. Make sure the clothes are distributed evenly or it will shake violently. I really like it because I can wash my clothes later at night & they’ll still be dry be morning after I hang them up.
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT. Lightweight, high speed spinner that gets 95% of the moisture out of your clothes in just 5 min or less. Just need to hang up to dry for another 20min or so.
customer_reviews.author: Chleosm

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this after my clothes come out of the washer and has already been spin dried in it. It still gets alot more water out of my clothes. I love this dryer! It seriously almost gets you clothes completely dry! It cut my hang drying time into 1 and a 1/2 hours, instead of 8-10 hours! I have already recommended it to my friends! Note: it's bigger than what it looks in pictures. The photos I took are of my son blanket that just came out of the washer! That's how much water the washer didn't get out when it did the spin cycle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over a year and it's still working perfectly. Outlasted two hand crank washing tubs. Clothes come out slightly damp, and everything but jeans and towels air dry completely within an hour or two. Jeans and towels typically need to dry overnight. Just make sure you load the clothing evenly or the inner drum will bang around.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: ... partner with my little panda washer and it works great. It will actually spin the clothes almost dry
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to partner with my little panda washer and it works great. It will actually spin the clothes almost dry. I hang them up and in about an hour, depending on the thickness of the fabric, the clothes are ready to wear. The machine is quiet. You do need to be careful when loading that you get a good balance in the clothes so it will spin and not dance, but I good that down very quickly and it has been drying clothes without a problem. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: granof12

customer_reviews.title: Nina Soft Spin Dryer
customer_reviews.text: This spin dryer works amazing! It gets out sooo much water and helps my cloths dry way faster then if I did not use it! Everyone should get one of these, also you can use it after your washer if you have a regular washer and dryer and you will see a huge difference in how much more quickly your cloths will dry. For me that means less time that my dryer has to be on and all you need with this spin dryer is a little bucket to collect the water.
customer_reviews.author: HPS Jeanann Sadler

customer_reviews.title: NINA Soft Spinner is a Winner!  I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: It is so quiet that I'm not worried about disturbing my fellow apartment dwellers! The clothing comes out barely damp and dries fairly quickly on racks--they would be dry in an hour if I had an outdoor line! I've wanted a Spinner since I borrowed one in the UK and swore that I would never buy a dryer if I could get a spinner that would run in the States. Now I finally have my dream spinner. I didn't have to hold this one in place and it didn't sound like a helicopter taking off, so this NINA Soft Spinner is delightful:) I will be saving so much money on electricity!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: First one didn’t turn on at all. I removed the bar at the bottom as directed. Replacement came and made some noise, but didn’t do anything else. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Howard

customer_reviews.title: Im a happy camper!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just tried it out right now and Im loving it. It does not use heat but it squeezes out all the water in your clothes and just comes out damp. This is perfect for winter. I currently use the washing wand in the bathtub to wash my work clothes, while I will be using the wonder washer for smaller items like socks and undergarments and daughters clothes. For its price this is a steal. Only time will tell regarding its durability.
customer_reviews.author: Humble

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I received a Nina Soft Spin Dryer machine that had been used. It gets thee stars because of how I received this: The package had been opened, the bottom of the machine had the styrophoam protection for the bottom in little chunks all inside the box, The plastic ties for protection were cut and the machine was dirty. The machine was not in its plastic enclosure. Too much hassle to return it and it works, so I plan to keep it I am upset for not receiving a new unopenned machine and I want the public to be aware of this. I hope it lasts me the 3 years that is covered by the warranty ...
customer_reviews.author: KathyC

customer_reviews.title: 3rd year still spinning!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you little Nina for keeping me out of my city's now awful public laundromats. This sweet dryer is perfect for what it does spins clothes damp, a quick shake hang up dry overnight often for a few hours then dry same as lugging home clothes you've spent 10 bucks washing and drying and are still damp. I sing when I use it, a happy song about not being around all those yucky men lounging in the laundromat! Make sure not to overload or you will think it doesn't work. I sometimes use those mesh laundry bags.
customer_reviews.author: FS

customer_reviews.title: Best spin dryer ever.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this spin dryer. It came super fast. It drys really fast, Nylon takes about 2 hours, cotton takes about six hours, towels about 2 hours socks and panties take about 4 hours, the cotton ones. If you decide to buy it and when you receive it and when you remove the metal bar from the bottom of it don't forget to cut the plastic rings, there actually cable ties cut down, otherwise the dryer won't work until they are. Also, after using it leave the lid open to dry so mold won't build up in it. Do the same with any mini washer before you store it.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Goliaszewski

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I cannot stress how much I LOVE this spinner! I hand wash all of my daughter's and my clothes , and I was stretching out our shirts trying to wring out the water. This product is fast, quiet and well worth the investment. If I fill the bin up to max capacity, the spinner takes only 4-5 minutes to get all of the water out. I would also recommend placing a large bowl underneath for the water ( I use a large cheap mixing bowl).
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Much More Effective than Spin Cycle
customer_reviews.text: This device is bigger than I expected, substantially bigger than a 5 gallon bucket. It does not have any timers or buttons - you plug it in and it spins; you unplug it to shut it off. I am line drying baby diapers and the diapers were taking a long time to dry. Now, I put the diapers through this device before hanging them up and they dry in an hour or two, the same as any other item. This device gets a lot of extra water out that the spin cycle on my washer does not.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Snyder

customer_reviews.title: IT IS NOT A DRYER. It is a water extractor and efficient at what it does.
customer_reviews.text: Some have commented this leaks; mine has not. When I got the hang of loading it, I never had and issue with it rocking or shifting. Very good at removing water from fabric. But with the water removed, there is no dripping and hanging to finish drying takes far less time.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: We love this dryer
customer_reviews.text: We love this dryer! We use it after washing and completing spin cycle in washer. Can't believe how much more water comes out. Turns an hour dry time into 10 or 15 minutes. Big money saver. We plan on using off grid because it's so energy efficient. Can't say enough good things about this product, we really love it!
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: I would give this product ten stars if I could.
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today and have used it to spin dry some heavy cotten sweats and a shower mat (not at the same time). All the other reviews convinced me to go ahead and purchase it as I live in an apartment with a community washer dryer. If you have a lot of handwashables like me, it is a great choice. I expected the spin to be a lot louder. I find it to spin very smoothly. The handle is great, too. Easy to fit in a closet or corner for storage, but still a good size to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: barbara ann hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: If you don't do laundry by hand or live in a hot climate this item isn't useful to you. But if you do air dry in a climate that's not windy and doesn't get beyond the high 60 degrees fahrenheit this is for you. This is a dependable appliance that will wring out 70-80% of the water so your clothes will dry in a reasonable amount of time. The only drawback is you have to be carefully to load the heaviest items first and evenly around interior or the machine will beat itself to death. But once you got that down you'll be golden.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: Changed my laundery life!
customer_reviews.text: It's GREAT! my sears washer, less than a year old, died May 205th. Lucky for me I have the wonder wash and now the Nina Spine Dryer. You should see what spins out of a towel. Dries on line or in dryer in minutes. The laundromat cost 5.49 a regular load. This pays for itself in months. My new washer dryer comes today and I'm going to see what extra water comes off my first load of towels. Great item
customer_reviews.author: Cha cha Fanucci

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this! The first one came damaged. But an email to the manufacturer, and a quick reply later, and a replacement wad on the way, hassle-free. It's quiet, powerful, and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: SbuxMellie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect-Almost
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this portable Spin Dry to use in our motor home that did not come with a washer dryer installed. I do not like spending money in a laundry mat on vacation and I thought this little unit would be perfect for our needs. It did what I wanted BUT I still had to take the clothes to the laundry to finish drying them. The good news though is--it took only about 45 minutes to completely dry three loads of clothes in one dryer. Just a few minutes for each load was all that was needed. I can live with that. I know I will get many years of use from this small portable spin dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Julie McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and energy
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was really fast (next day). Removing the styrofoam protection sheet from the inside is tricky, try to remove it in one piece. This spin dryer gets approximately 1 to 1,3 liters of water out of laundry removed from the washing machine. The drying process after that is a lot faster using either drying rack or dryer. Runs without a lot of noise. Saves time and energy. Almost all parts are made of plastic but I think that keeps the price reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid F.

customer_reviews.title: but almost anything else is pretty dry after using this spinner
customer_reviews.text: Yes it will shake if the clothes inside are not evenly dispersed within. That's just physics. But for the most part, once you place a hand on it it will stop, balance itself and spin nearly all the water out of your clothes in less than five minutes. You really can just air dry after this. Jeans may take longer, but almost anything else is pretty dry after using this spinner. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: blisskitty

customer_reviews.title: It does a good job once it gets going but it's a pain to get the load balanced
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job once it gets going but it's a pain to get the load balanced. It's so temperamental - I usually need to load / unload the laundry 3 - 4 times and you can't fill it more than 2/3 of the way - this translates into a couple of large shirts and a few socks. They should put some rollers on the inside of the case near the top of the Laundry Basket (the part that spins) so when tips it can't go so far that it unbalances the load.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Gormley

customer_reviews.title: I've had this since 2015 and it does what I ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since 2015 and it does what I needed to do. After I come home from the gym I wash out by hand my exercise clothes, shorts & shirt, and put them in the spinner that's in my garage for three to five minutes. The performance fabric is just about dry. I hang them up on a line and within two or three hours they are bone dry. The ambient temperature and humidity level plays a major factor but generally on non raining days this is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping or appartment
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the 1st one, but the 2nd one sent has been great. We use this for camping, wish I had it when I lived in an apartment. Cloths dry very fast now. I am surprised how much water it extracts.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Get it.
customer_reviews.text: MUST for apartments with no laundry. Couldn’t imagine living without one. A little bulky, but it's power necessitates the size. 1000 percent could not live without one now.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Z.

customer_reviews.title: So Good It Messes with the Natural Order of the Universe
customer_reviews.text: All the great things that everyone else says is true. Proof that this machine messes with the natural order of the universe = I no longer lose socks in the laundry when I dry them in this.
customer_reviews.author: Lyric Traveler

customer_reviews.title: This Nina Soft Spun Dryeris excellent. It can team with a small single tub ...
customer_reviews.text: This Nina Soft Spun Dryeris excellent. It can team with a small single tub washer. holding a full tub load, it spins water out effortlessly.Laundry is ready to dry speedily. Five stars. M J Tate
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane Tate

customer_reviews.title: easy, and much cheaper than dragging everything to the ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the Wonderwash. It spins clothes to a nearly dry state without damage. Laundry duties are now quick, easy, and much cheaper than dragging everything to the laundromat, and can be done whenever I want.
customer_reviews.author: AmmaLittleOwl

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't remove much more water than washing machine spin cycle
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it's my fault, but I didn't realize that if you have access to a washing machine with a decent spin cycle then this spin dryer will not remove that much more water than the washing machine already does.
customer_reviews.author: blueskies

customer_reviews.title: We got this for our cabin. We have a ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our cabin. We have a mini washer and we use this for our spin cycle. Works really well. Clothes come our slightly damp but so much dryer than when they come out of our regular automatic washer in our house. Really cuts down on the amount of time the clothes need to be in the dryer. We're thinking of getting one for our house to cut down on dryer time for our clothes at home.
customer_reviews.author: Swiggyoregon

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing, dont think twice if you need a spinner
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a year now. I cannot say enough about it. I love it. We dont have a washing machine at home and i was my daughters clothes at home with my eco washer and put in spinner. Everything is dry the next day or even couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: ugur

customer_reviews.title: Great for hand spinners
customer_reviews.text: I was using a stainless steel salad spinner to spin washed wool fleece dry but the arthritis in my hands made it quite painful. I bought the Nina spin dryer and am so glad I did; it is just perfect for my needs. The fleece is much dryer and can be stored after only a few hours rather than a few days. The only minor “con” is hurting my knuckles if I’m not careful when turning it off. But I highly recommended it to hand spinners who wash their own fleece.
customer_reviews.author: KatyKat

customer_reviews.title: Love having a big centrifuge!
customer_reviews.text: It's a centrifuge. I really like it and use it to save money doing daily laundry--too small to work with anything larger than a twin size sheet. We recently had to downsize and move to an apartment in an area where the cost of living is rather expensive, but I wanted to have clean clothes for obvious reasons. It dries well, but I do put the clothing on a drying rack to finish since it doesn't totally dry most clothes completely. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: klu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, used with hand washed clothes that were sopping wet for a while, and now that I have a washing machine, I use it to spin dry what comes out of the washing machine. This does a great job getting out almost all of the water. It takes only a couple of hours to hang dry clothes that come out of this and way less dryer time if you go that route. Saves me time and energy .
customer_reviews.author: hacha

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine. It is quiet and efficient. It extracts lots of water; especially after using the gentle cycle to wash them in the washing machine. This leaves less time in the dryer or on the clothes line. I plan on using it as well for drying sheep wool. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: More Than Worth the Investment
customer_reviews.text: After our family moved to an apartment, I was shocked at how much a trip to the laundromat cost. I was not willing to spend that much simply on washing, so I looked at other alternatives. I bought this a month ago, to use with the breathable hand washer, and I have to say I LOVE it! It's amazing how much water it spins out; the clothes really come out about 85% dry. I use a laundry drying rack to let them dry the rest of the way and I've had no complaints. This far exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Nina Soft Dryer Works Great-Very Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I really love the Nina Soft Spin Dryer! I have had it for a couple of days. It works really great. It gets the water out of clothes , so they're almost dry. Not one drop of water could be squeezed out of the clothes or towels, after using this machine. I'm glad that I got the spin dryer, it helped me out a lot, and is very efficient. Easy to use. Easy to lift and carry to where ever you need it to go. Very nice product and attractive. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Gail Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: My Spin Dryer so glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: This spin dryer is a god send, I just love it. I had already posted about it, and said that it was leaking all over the floor with the basin I was using, Well it wasn't the spin dryer, it was the basin that had a crack in it. I did get a five quart mixing bowl with pour spout and handle and it really works well with the spin dryer. It does spin the clothes and towels almost dry. Takes about an hour to dry the clothes on my dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Laundry delight.
customer_reviews.text: The Laundry Alternative Nina Soft Spin Dryer works like a charm. Just make sure you have balanced the load equally around the tub. Powerful yet acceptably quiet, wet-from-the-washer-clothes come out nearly dry, and they have been treated gently. Just hang them up, and they will be ready to wear or be put away quickly. Or better yet, buy the VonHaus heated drying rack, a work of art in itself, for more immediate gratification and no more washday blues.
customer_reviews.author: Teller Forreal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent companion for portable machines
customer_reviews.text: We don't have washer/dryer hookups, so we've had to improvise with a spare bathroom and a portable washer and dryer. The spin dryer dramatically reduced drying times in our Haier. Maybe we just need to get out more, but we were so excited with reduced laundry times that we told family and neighbors about our discovery.The unit we received was good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anyone who washes clothes by hand
customer_reviews.text: I hand wash clothes often and it can take a couple of days to dry....I don't have super strong hands and am unable to wring them out well. Especially jeans. This spin dryer worked perfectly. Others have already posted excellent tips on using it so I won't bother, but the one thing I will say is that the first time I used it I did make a bit of a mess by getting water everywhere. If I'd known better I would've had a couple towels handy while I figured out how I was going to set this up. But that isn't the company's fault. This worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over a years ago and have not had to use a laundromat since. My kitchen sink is large enough to wash everything, and then it all fits into this little spin dryer. It comes out dry enough to hang in a closet to finish drying overnight. Clothes feel much cleaner and fresher than using a laundromat too. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Petrison

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing I washed all my sweaters cashmere too
customer_reviews.text: Okay I grow up having this 40 years ago ( Europe) I always want to have it again and I got it . This is amazing I washed all my sweaters cashmere too!!! When you use it your clothes are almost dry. Ladies is good to have it
customer_reviews.author: shoelover

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that would make this better is a custom catch basin for the water
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that would make this better is a custom catch basin for the water. Every bowl i have tried still ends up leaking on the floor because they don't rest snug against the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Seem like a great spinner so far!!
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great little spinner so far! Quite happy with it and hope it lasts a LONG TIME!!!
customer_reviews.author: Les

product_meta.title: The Laundry Alternative Nina Soft Spin Dryer
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe new Nina comes with a tall, built-in handle that makes transport easier and keeps bending to a minimum. Better still, this portable dryer machine only weighs a comparatively light 15lbs, and at 136W, is 100 times as energy efficient as a conventional dryer.Nina Soft Spin Dryer is that, with a super quick 1800-RPM spin speed, it effectively removes most of the water that your washing machine doesn't.
feature_bullets: Laundry is 90% dry in under 3 minutes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars813 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
